comment._content: I don't think the date on this is right. Judging from the clothing and Einstein's appearance, I'd probably say it was late 40's or early 50's.

comment._content: Yup if the date was right, Albert would be in diapers!

comment.author: 27811631@N03
comment._content: It is really cool that everyone  is identified by their autograph. I think that they are all Physics Nobel Prize winners.

comment.author: 95471541@N00
comment._content: This very same photo (though not with the autographs), is apparently part of the Emilio Segre Visual Archives (http://photos.aip.org/searchResult2.jsp?item_id=Bohr%20Niels%20D5&fname=bohr_niels_d5.jpg&title=null&description=L-R:%20Bohr,%20Franck,%20Einstein,%20Rabi,%20on%20the%20occasion%20of%20Franck's%20and%20Einstein's%20receiving%20honorary%20degrees%20of%20the%20Technion%20Israel%20Institute%20of%20Technology;%20Princeton;&credit=AIP%20Emilio%20Segre%20Visual%20Archives,%20Margrethe%20Bohr%20Collection&photoDate=null&storePublished=Y&color=null&names=Bohr,%20Niels%20Henrik%20David;%20Franck,%20James;%20Rabi,%20Isidor%20Isaac;%20Einstein,%20Albert&contactID=null)  -- sorry for the long URL -- which is part of the Niels Bohr Library of the Center for History of Physics at the American Institute of Physics.  This photo is part of the "Margrethe Bohr Collection."  On the page cited above, there is a list of purchase prices and service fees.  The scientists pictured are (left to right) Niles Bohr, James Franck, Albert Einstein, I.I. Rabi, and they were together "on the occasion of Franck's and Einstein's receiving honorary degrees of the Technion Israel Institute of Technology."

comment.author: 22917684@N00
comment._content: The date was probably October 3rd, 1954. See the NYTimes article.

comment.author: 7576993@N07
comment._content:
Thank you for taking the time to comment on our photo! Since these photos were acquired from various print dealers by our donor, Bern Dibner, in the 1940’s, our records for the collection are a bit sparse. 

Although we currently do not have staff available to do further research, your comments will be extremely valuable in helping us update the information for this image.

comment.author: 80454089@N00
comment._content: For ease of use, I have taken the liberty of reformatting the valuable comment by almadenmike. I have added nothing! The scientists pictured are (left to right) Niles Bohr, James Franck, Albert Einstein, I.I. Rabi, and they were together "on the occasion of Franck's and Einstein's receiving honorary degrees of the Technion Israel Institute of Technology." This very same photo (though not with the autographs), is apparently part of the Emilio Segre Visual Archives which is part of the Niels Bohr Library of the Center for History of Physics at the American Institute of Physics. This photo is part of the "Margrethe Bohr Collection." On the page cited above, there is a list of purchase prices and service fees.

comment._content: Years ago, I went to Oak Ridge, Tennessee to see the old graphite reactor at ORNL.  There was a chair there that they said was used by Einstein, and I actually go to sit in it.  It's about the only thing Einstein and I have in common.
